references.paper_title: A reduction of a graph to a canonical form and an algebra arising during this reduction
references.reason: This paper introduces the Weisfeiler-Lehman (WL) test, a foundational algorithm for graph isomorphism and a basis for many graph kernel methods and GNNs.

references.paper_title: Efficient graphlet kernels for large graph comparison
references.reason: This paper introduces a graph kernel method based on counting the occurrences of small subgraph patterns, which is among the earliest and most influential methods in graph kernel research.
This paper formally defines and analyzes the Weisfeiler-Lehman subtree kernel, a powerful graph kernel based on the iterative WL test, which has strong ties to GNNs.

references.paper_title: On valid optimal assignment kernels and applications to graph classification
references.reason: This paper introduces the Weisfeiler-Lehman optimal assignment (WLOA) kernel, which improves upon WL subtree kernel and exhibits strong consistency properties that are relevant to GNNs.

references.paper_title: Semi-supervised classification with graph convolutional networks
references.reason: This influential paper introduces graph convolutional networks (GCNs), a seminal work that sparked widespread research in GNNs and is fundamental to many modern approaches.
